posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
We have a new mentor on the team who has CADD experience. He has already helped out a lot already, and his experience is in Solidworks. I have put in for a license as he is going to teach us how to use Solidworks. However, it is build season, and we are experienced with Onshape. So, he is willing to learn a bit of that so we can continue making progress through the build-season while we each learn something new.

Is it possible to get him access to the team version of the Onshape account? Currently, everything happens automatically for the students and me as our emails are in the district domain.

If so, does anyone know the path to onboarding our other new mentors and him?

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked: Not sure how your district does it, but for us everyone creates an individual education account, and then we add them to the team in Onshape - so anyone can join and get access, regardless of email address.

posts.name: UnofficialForth
posts.cooked:
In the past, I’ve put all my students and mentors as educational, since that’s the main purpose of what we are using onshape for. Much like programming, since your mentor is experienced with CAD before, it’s more about learning the syntax of Onshape rather than the design principles of CAD.

I highly suggest jumping into the Onshape Fundamentals Pathway for starters. It will allow them to understand the processes of doing most of their favorite CAD things the Onshape way.

There is a new Pathway called CAD For Robotics Competitions that looks like it could be super useful too, though I personally haven’t done it yet.

As someone who frequently uses version control, the Onshape Fundamentals: Data Management pathway is a super useful course in understanding how to run a high functioning team in parallel.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC Team 4272  Mentor | World's FLL Emcee

posts.custom_user_title: FRC Team 4272  Mentor | World's FLL Emcee

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked: Previous instructions from OnShape were to have the mentors apply for an education account as ‘faculty/teacher/whatever.’

posts.name: Mr.R^2

posts.cooked: If you need help with this, just email me, and I will walk you through it. Don.biery@motsd.org

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked: I am not an employee of the district I mentor at, nor do I have a school or team email address. I signed up for Onshape through the normal educator sign up here Signup for Onshape for Education and was able to get an education account. If I recall, there was an option for robotics competition during the signup process.
